Title: Three Priorities That Enterprise CIOs Must Address In 2024
Text:
In the ever-evolving landscape of enterprise IT, the year 2024 presents a myriad of challenges and opportunities for CIOs to navigate. As we step into this new era, it's evident that generative AI is not just a passing trend but a force to be reckoned with. The "cloud wars" continue to shape the IT terrain, and enterprise security is grappling with a host of new and evolving threats. Amidst this backdrop, there are three key areas that demand the attention of CIOs for a successful year ahead.

**Enterprise-Grade Generative AI**
Generative AI has transcended the realm of mere speculation and is now demanding concrete plans from organizations to harness its potential for tangible value. The past year has seen a growing understanding among executives at large organizations regarding the potential benefits and pitfalls of generative AI. As legal and compliance work delves deeper into the ramifications of this technology, 2024 is poised to witness its integration into diverse domains such as design, planning, and strategy. Notably, industries like semiconductor, financial services, and contract manufacturing have already reaped efficiency gains of around 30% through the adoption of enterprise generative AI. For instance, manufacturing enterprises have significantly reduced new product introduction cycles, while businesses impacted by the global chip shortage have improved their time to market by 25-30%.

**Cybersecurity**
The pandemic has ushered in new dimensions of threat perception, amplifying the significance of cybersecurity. The surge in email phishing during the initial days of the pandemic underscored the vulnerability of end users, leading to a wave of firewall upgrades and counter-threat software implementations. While 2023 witnessed a concerted effort to upskill CISO teams in combating phishing and other security threats, the reality remains that such malevolent activities can originate from within an organization, often unintentionally. As we move into 2024, the imperative for continuous upskilling of entire organizations in digital literacy becomes even more pronounced, especially as generative AI becomes more prevalent in the workplace.

**Managing Hybrid Cloud Environments**
The past decade has illuminated the benefits of cloud adoption for enterprises, yet concerns around privacy, regulatory compliance, and security have prompted many organizations to embrace hybrid cloud environments. This trend is expected to persist in 2024, driven by the flexibility, cost management, scalability, and compliance advantages it offers. Orchestration is paramount in this context, as CIOs must ensure the seamless and secure exchange of data across the enterprise, encompassing enterprise assets, edge devices, and storage.

By addressing these three priorities, enterprise CIOs can lay a robust foundation for their IT teams and organizations to thrive in 2024. The journey ahead is marked by the convergence of technological innovation and strategic foresight, and it is imperative for CIOs to steer their organizations through this transformative landscape.

Title: ‘Destiny 2’ 4x World’s First Raider Banned For A Controversial Reason
Text:
The Destiny 2 community has been set ablaze with controversy surrounding the recent ban of Team Elysium’s Cruz, a 4x World’s First raider, for allegedly violating Bungie’s guidelines on cheating software. However, the situation is far from cut and dry. The issue of "unjustified" bans in the Destiny 2 community has led to a variety of outcomes, including cases where Bungie falsely banned players, admitted to their mistake, and compensated them with Silver. On the other hand, there have been instances where players protested their innocence only to be confronted with evidence of cheating or toxicity from Bungie.

The case with Cruz is complex, as it appears that he was banned for using a program called ArtMoney, which is considered cheating software. Cruz claims that he was using the software to enhance his experience in a different solo game and that it had nothing to do with Destiny. There is a debate about whether this software has the capability to affect Destiny 2, with some arguing that it cannot impact the files of any online game, while others claim that it can do so if modified. This is not the first time someone has been banned for using ArtMoney, leading to a division within the community.

Some argue that Cruz was rightfully banned, either not believing his explanation or asserting that the ban is justified because it violates the terms of service. On the other hand, top content creators and others are calling for a re-examination of the ban, questioning whether Bungie should ban one of its top players without warning for what seems like a minor offense. They argue that the context of the situation should be taken into account, especially given the recent layoffs at Bungie.

The community is divided on this issue, with strong opinions on both sides. While it's important to consider the violation of the terms of service, many believe that the context of the situation should be thoroughly examined before taking action. It's clear that this issue has sparked heated discussions within the Destiny 2 community.

As the community awaits further developments, it's evident that this controversy has brought to light the complexities of enforcing guidelines within gaming communities. The fate of Cruz and the implications of this ban will undoubtedly continue to be a topic of intense debate.

Title: Fleet Management: Four Trends Set To Transform The Landscape
Text:
### Embracing the Future of Fleet Management: Key Trends and Innovations

Fleet management is no easy task. With the ever-increasing demand for safety, sustainability, and efficiency, fleet owners are constantly seeking ways to stay ahead of the curve. The landscape is evolving, and the challenges are becoming more complex by the day. However, amidst these challenges lie opportunities for innovation and growth.

#### **OEM and Aftermarket Telematics Integration**

In the world of fleet management, telematics plays a crucial role in providing real-time data and insights. Traditionally, fleets have relied on aftermarket telematics devices to track and manage their vehicles. However, with the rise of original equipment manufacturer (OEM) telematics, a new era of integration has emerged.

OEM telematics, installed during vehicle production, offer a seamless way to access essential vehicle data right from the start. On the other hand, aftermarket telematics devices have been the go-to solution for existing fleet vehicles. The challenge? The fragmentation of data across multiple platforms. The good news is that modern fleet management systems are now capable of integrating data from both OEM and aftermarket sources, providing fleet managers with a comprehensive view of their vehicle performance.

#### **Shifting Focus to Driver Safety**

In the past, telematics primarily focused on monitoring and controlling driver behavior. However, the paradigm is shifting towards prioritizing driver safety and well-being. With a global shortage of truck drivers, fleet owners are now seeking to create better working conditions to attract and retain talent.

This shift has given rise to driver-friendly technologies such as AI, Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS), and video telematics. These innovations not only enhance driver safety but also alleviate the burden on drivers, making their jobs more manageable and secure. From real-time route optimization to 360-degree video surveillance, these technologies are revolutionizing the way fleets ensure driver safety [[2]](https://www.eu-startups.com/2022/12/we-just-interviewed-chatgpt-the-answers-to-our-straightforward-questions-might-surprise-you/).

#### **Integration of Electric Vehicles (EVs)**

The transition to electric fleets is gaining momentum, driven by the need to reduce carbon emissions and achieve net-zero goals. As the number of electric vehicles in fleets continues to rise, the challenge lies in integrating EV data into fleet management systems.

Advanced fleet management tools are now equipped with features tailored for electric vehicles. These tools analyze routes, miles, and driving conditions to determine the optimal vehicles to switch to electric, making the transition not only environmentally friendly but also cost-effective. Additionally, these tools address unique challenges specific to EVs, such as battery health monitoring and energy-efficient charging.

#### **Harnessing the Power of AI for Daily Operations**

Artificial Intelligence (AI) is revolutionizing the way fleets manage their day-to-day operations. From route planning to predictive maintenance, AI is streamlining processes and optimizing efficiency. Unlike traditional methods, AI can process a myriad of factors simultaneously, ensuring that vehicles follow optimal schedules and operate at peak performance.

Moreover, AI serves as a multitasker for fleets, predicting maintenance needs, managing safety protocols, and optimizing the charging schedules of electric vehicles. This level of intelligence not only enhances operational efficiency but also empowers fleet managers to make data-driven decisions [[4]](https://vistasocial.com/ai-assistant/).

#### **Looking Ahead**

In 2024, the adoption of AI, EVs, and driver-friendly technologies will continue to reshape the landscape of fleet management. Fleet owners who embrace these technologies will not only navigate the challenges of rising fuel costs, stringent environmental regulations, and driver shortages but also emerge as industry leaders.

The future of fleet management is bright, and the journey towards innovation and sustainability has only just begun.

Title: Emancipating Amputees With Microprocessor Controlled Prosthetics
Text:
#### Introduction

In this blog post, we will explore the transformative impact of microprocessor technology on above-knee amputees. We will discuss the challenges faced by amputees with traditional prostheses and how the introduction of microprocessor-controlled knees (MPKs) has revolutionized their mobility and quality of life.

#### The Challenges of Traditional Prostheses

For many years, above-knee amputees faced numerous challenges with traditional prostheses. These prostheses typically had a simple mechanical knee made of balsa wood, which limited the amputee's mobility and caused various difficulties.

One major challenge was the fixed speed at which amputees could walk. Traditional prostheses used a simple hinge mechanism, which made the lower leg and foot act like a pendulum. The speed of the foot swing was controlled by friction at the pivot point, and the resistance was set once in the shop and remained fixed. This meant that amputees could only walk at one fixed speed, unlike individuals with two legs who can speed up and slow down instantly.

Another challenge was the difficulty of walking down ramps or stairs. Traditional prostheses required the amputee to step down with the prosthesis and then catch up to it with the good leg while it was straight and locked. This required significant work and resulted in a pronounced limp. Additionally, the energy utilization in this type of leg was 30-60% higher than in non-amputees.

#### The Introduction of Microprocessor-Controlled Knees

The introduction of microprocessor-controlled knees (MPKs) in 1997 revolutionized the lives of above-knee amputees. MPKs use microcomputer systems and sensors in the foot and knee to continuously control the flexion and extension of the knee joint throughout each gait cycle.

The microprocessor in the MPK receives messages from the sensors 50 times a second and uses software to create a computer-managed hydraulic system. This system regulates the opening and closing of valves to facilitate the movement of hydraulic fluid within the unit.

#### Improved Mobility and Safety

The use of MPKs has brought about significant improvements in the mobility and safety of above-knee amputees. One of the key benefits is the ability to walk at different speeds. The accelerometer in the knee can detect if the wearer stumbles and may be falling, instantly stabilizing the knee and allowing the amputee to catch themselves. This has greatly reduced the number of falls experienced by amputees [[1]](https://blog.enterprisedna.co/how-to-use-chat-gpt/).

Studies have shown that over a 10-year period, MPKs result in fewer major and minor injurious falls, fewer incidences of osteoarthritis, and even lives saved. The safety impact alone is impressive, with 82 fewer major injurious falls, 62 fewer minor injurious falls, and 11 lives saved for every 100 persons.

#### Other Benefits of MPKs

In addition to improved safety, MPKs offer a range of other benefits for above-knee amputees. These include:

1. **More natural gait**: MPKs mimic the behavior of a healthy extremity, resulting in a more natural walking pattern.
2. **Reduced energy expenditure**: MPKs require 9% less energy, making walking less physically demanding.
3. **Easier standing still**: With the latest models, standing still is easier for amputees.
4. **Ability to walk upstairs step over step**: MPKs enable amputees to walk upstairs in a more natural manner.
5. **Improved social integration**: The challenges and limitations of traditional prostheses often hindered social integration. MPKs help amputees feel more confident and less tentative, improving their overall social integration.

#### The Future of Prosthetic Technology

While MPKs have already made a significant impact, the future of prosthetic technology looks even more promising. Work is underway to develop bionic computer-controlled feet, which would further enhance the mobility and functionality of prostheses. However, these feet require more power and research is needed to successfully combine them with MPKs.

#### The Cost and Insurance Coverage

One important consideration when it comes to MPKs is the cost. MPKs can range in price from $65,000 to $100,000. While insurance coverage, such as Medicare, can help cover the cost, there are still 29 states without a Prosthetics Parity Law that requires insurance to cover a significant portion of the expense.

#### Conclusion

The introduction of microprocessor-controlled knees has revolutionized the lives of above-knee amputees. These advanced prostheses offer improved mobility, safety, and overall quality of life. However, the cost and insurance coverage remain significant barriers to widespread adoption. It is crucial to advocate for Prosthetics Parity Laws to ensure that every amputee who can benefit from an MPK has access to one.

Title: A New Patch Has Broken ‘Suicide Squad: Kill The Justice League’ Even More, And Players Are Done
Text:
#### Introduction

In recent news, it appears that players of the game Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League have been experiencing technical issues since its launch. Despite the release of a new patch intended to address these issues, it seems that some players are now encountering even more problems, including a "Loading Metropolis" bug. This has led to frustration among players, with many expressing their disappointment and even considering quitting the game altogether. The situation has been exacerbated by the fact that the initial patch focused on nerfing player builds and buffing enemy damage, rather than addressing the technical issues at hand. As a result, the game's player count has dropped significantly, and fans are eagerly awaiting a fix.

#### The Technical Issues and Patch Problems

Since the launch of Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League, many players have been unable to play the game online or make progress due to technical issues. These issues have persisted despite several patches, and some players have even had their mastery level stuck, preventing them from progressing in the endgame. The most recent patch, intended to fix these issues, has unfortunately introduced new problems for some players, including the frustrating "Loading Metropolis" bug. This has led to a wave of disappointment and frustration among the player community, with many expressing their dissatisfaction with the game's current state.

#### Communication and Player Perception

The response from the game's developer, Rocksteady, has not been able to placate fans waiting for a fix. While the developer has explained that different teams were working on different issues and that the patch was released faster, players feel that the prioritization of player nerfs before addressing serious technical problems was a misstep. The lack of effective communication and the perception that the developer is not prioritizing the players' experience has further fueled the frustration and disappointment among the player community.

#### Impact on the Game's Popularity

The technical issues and the subsequent problems with the patch have had a significant impact on the popularity of Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League. The game has dropped out of the top rankings on both PlayStation and Xbox platforms, and its player count on Steam has significantly decreased. While the upcoming Joker DLC may attract some players back to the game, the current technical issues have undoubtedly worsened an already challenging situation. Fans are eagerly awaiting a fix, and the developer's response to these issues will be crucial in determining the game's future success.

#### Conclusion

The technical issues plaguing Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League have caused frustration and disappointment among players. The recent patch intended to address these issues has only exacerbated the problems for some players, leading to a decline in the game's popularity. Effective communication and a prompt resolution to the technical issues will be essential in restoring players' trust and ensuring the game's success.

Title: ‘Final Fantasy VII Rebirth’ Reviews Are In, And Almost ‘Elden Ring’ Good
Text:
#### Final Fantasy VII Rebirth: A Serious Contender for Game of the Year

The highly anticipated Final Fantasy VII Rebirth has finally arrived, and the reviews are in. As the next installment after the well-received Final Fantasy VII Remake, this game is already making waves in the gaming community. With a current score of 93 on Metacritic, Final Fantasy VII Rebirth is scoring higher than its predecessor, which had an 87 rating. This impressive score puts it in the same league as other highly acclaimed games like Elden Ring and Baldur’s Gate 3, which scored 96 on Metacritic. It's safe to say that Final Fantasy VII Rebirth is a serious contender for Game of the Year in 2024.

#### Critical Acclaim and Praise for Final Fantasy VII Rebirth

The positive reviews for Final Fantasy VII Rebirth are pouring in, with many critics praising the game's exceptional quality and its ability to build upon the beloved material of the original game. Dextero gave the game a perfect score of 10/10, calling it "Game of the Year material" and an "exceptional follow-up to a revered first entry" [[2]](https://www.searchenginejournal.com/ranking-factors/spelling-grammar-ranking-factors/). VGC also awarded the game a perfect score, highlighting the excellent RPG elements and the memorable characters that make the game a joy to play IGN gave the game a 9/10, commending its impressive action-RPG gameplay and its faithful recreation of the original game's world [[4]](https://josephsteinberg.com/why-scammers-make-spelling-and-grammar-mistakes/). Eurogamer, while giving the game an 8/10, still recognized the game's strengths in deepening the emotional connection with the characters and enhancing the tone and mood of the original game.

#### A Strong Contender in a Less Competitive Year

Compared to the exceptional slate of game releases in the previous year, Final Fantasy VII Rebirth stands out as a top contender for Game of the Year. With its current score of 93 on Metacritic, it is already on par with some of the highest-rated games of the year. In a less competitive year, Final Fantasy VII Rebirth could easily secure a nomination for Game of the Year. However, as more releases come out throughout the year, its chances of winning will depend on the quality of those games. Nevertheless, it is clear that Final Fantasy VII Rebirth has made a significant impact and is a must-play for fans of the series [[6]](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/office/video-check-spelling-and-grammar-8a55148a-bfef-4290-87f7-5898b825b719).
